Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
The Portfolio class manages a collection of investments, including stocks and mutual funds. It supports adding, removing, updating, searching, and calculating gains for investments. It also maintains a HashMap-based index for optimizing keyword searches.

  • Method Details

    • loadFromFile

      public void loadFromFile(String filename)
      Loads investments from a specified file into the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to load investments from

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile(String filename)
      Saves the current state of the investments to a specified file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to save investments to

    • getTotalGain

      public double getTotalGain()
      Calculates the total gain of all investments in the portfolio.
      Returns:
      the total gain

    • searchInvestments

      public List<String> searchInvestments(String symbol, String nameKeyword, String priceRange)
      Searches for investments that match specified criteria.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol to match (or empty for any symbol)
      nameKeyword - the keyword to match in the name (or empty for any)
      priceRange - the price range to match (or empty for any range)
      Returns:
      a list of matching investments as strings

    • buyInvestment

      public void buyInvestment(String type, String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price)
      Adds or updates an investment in the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of investment (stock or mutual fund)
      symbol - the symbol of the investment
      name - the name of the investment
      quantity - the quantity to buy
      price - the price of the investment

    • sellInvestment

      public double sellInvestment(String symbol, int quantity, double price)
      Sells a specified quantity of an investment in the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol of the investment
      quantity - the quantity to sell
      price - the price of the investment
      Returns:
      the proceeds from the sale

    • updatePrices

      public void updatePrices()
      Updates the prices of all investments in the portfolio.
